title: Best bars: Sevva, Sky Bar, Aer | Travel | Travel News and Holiday Deals |
text:
Whether they’re perched on cliff faces or towering over the big city lights, these are the bars you need to place on your list of things to do, now.
Cova d’en Xoroi, Menorca
Nestled into the cliffs on the south coast of the island of Menorca, Cova d’en Xoroi bar has spectacular views for sipping cocktails and listening to soothing Cafe del Mar type beats.
Watch the sunset from Cova d’en Xoroi. Source: Facebook
Hotel de Glace (Ice Hotel), Quebec
Every Canadian winter, this magical ice hotel opens for business. With 44 rooms and suites, huge snow vaults and ice sculptures, you can settle in for the night at the ice bar where drinks are served in ice cups.
The magical ice bar hotel in Canada. Source: Facebook
Rock Bar, Bali
Perched on a cliff face 14 metres above the Indian Ocean, Rock Bar in Bali is the place to unwind with a drink and sunset views.
One of the best spots in Bali to grab a Bintang. Source: Supplied
Sevva, Hong Kong
Looking out over the bright lights of Hong Kong island, Sevva is a favourite of expats who go for the incredible views, cocktails and flowing champagne. Grab a table outside and watch the light show.
Part of the bright lights of Hong Kong at Sevva. Source: Facebook
Sky Bar, Bangkok
Touted as “the” bar to go to in Bangkok, it also featured on the movie The Hangover . The winner of numerous awards you can enjoy the best views of Bangkok with affordable cocktails.
The award-winning Sky Bar. Source: News Limited
Aer, Mumbai
At the top of the Four Seasons hotel in Mumbai is an open air bar with cocktails and snacks and fantastic views. It’s the perfect place to escape the busy streets below.
